Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Crystal M. "CM"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.0 is great.  I use i for everthing. You wont be dissappointed.  Find it onsale :-)

Reviews.Title: If you are an Android fan this is a great Tab
Reviews.Author: Doug "Doug"
Reviews.Content: I own the Note 2 and this just compliments it.  I use this for business and personal use.  Works well.  The size is perfect and having the S-pen to takes notes then email the PDF to myself is excellent.  Its not to heavy to read books on and the battery life is definitely above average.

Reviews.Title: I'm glad I waited
Reviews.Author: Alex B
Reviews.Content: This tab is AMAZING! I absolutely love it, it's everything I expected, the weight, size, the capacity. It's just amazing. Surprised how long the battery last, as much as I use it.

Reviews.Title: A Worthy Update over the 1st Galaxy Tab 10.1
Reviews.Author: Stat1124
Reviews.Content: I purchased the first galaxy tab when it was released over a year ago and was pretty happy with my purchase.  Was it the end all be all, no but it left not much to complain about.  This holiday season I had the opportunity to upgrade and holy smokes, let me tell you what a great idea it was.  This tablet is sexy and sleek.  The motions are so fluid and I haven't even received the new software update which is suppose to make it even more smoother.  The S Pen is very impressive.  Its lightweight with a small rounded tip that gives you crazy precision. The S Pen tucks away into the bottom right corner of the tablet and it was designed so carefully, you can barely tell it is even supposed to come out. It is by far the most precise pen/stylus I have used so far.  Very happy with that.  It also has a ton of new features I haven't even begun to unravel but the Photoshop Touch app was done smartly and I see myself getting a lot of use out of it.  One of the biggest bonuses is Micro SD slot allows me to never have to worry about running out of space again.  How sweet it is.  Oh I must say that the multiscreen feature was what I had been waiting for from a productivity standpoint for a long time and it delivered pretty well.  Its a little buggy when using Polaris Office and the web browser.  It continues to crash on me but all the other multiscreens work great.  S Note and S Planner are reasons to by the tablet by itself.  Talk about a seriously thought out integration of note taking with calendar planning and synchronization.  I have been able to sync my work, home and Google up with no problem at all.  Seeing everything in one place and to be able to jot notes and retrieve them when I need them, it has completely eliminated EverNote for me.All in all, I think Samsung really out did themselves and this a pretty darn good product.  If you are considering this product, head over to:  [...].  Its a guide to help you get familiar with the tablet and was very informative.The only reason this didn't receive 5 Stars from me is that I have yet to see an absolutely perfect gadget produced for the masses.  However this one comes pretty close.  If you buy this tablet, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Totally Happy!
Reviews.Author: CGalvis
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 is the best tablet there is!!! I has met my expectations and beyond, totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Eddy Martinez "Eddyx"
Reviews.Content: There are enough reviews dealing with specs and benchmarks, I will only offer my opinion having  owned other tablets. This tablet it amazing, it is fast and can really multitask.  The Stylus is the key, it is accurate and smooth. Writing with the stylus is like writing with a pen, there is so much potential for software developers with this device.  The S apps are user friendly, multiscreen is a very nice feature as well as the floating apps. I have used the photoshop app that is preinstalled, it is similar to the photoshop for PC/MAC just not as robust, having this top level tool on a tablet really takes it to the next level of functionality.  The line between tablet and laptop is narrowing with the Galaxy Note. Between the unique software and powerful processor the other players in the market are going to have to step up their game.

Reviews.Title: long learning curve on pen...but can get good results
Reviews.Author: john Lampe
Reviews.Content: I'm a want to be artist and reluctant construction guy of homes (enjoy the design and build, not the clients). Been waiting for a tablet to come out that has real artist/designer sensitive drawing capacity. This tablet does, but the drawing pen has so many variable to learn to use I recommend putting aside at least 7 - 10 hours to really learn all it does. You can get very good results with pen. For first 3 days I was disappointing with pen results until I learn to push as hard as I would with a mechanical pencil using a #2 HB lead. Harder than you think you should. After that I got the graduated scales of grey and ability to gain depth of pen stroke that I was hoping to get out of a touch sensitive pen vs the regular tablet interface. Overall, if I work it, I can get very good drawings out of tablet....near artist quality like pen and ink or pencil grey scale. You will not be producing large scale on art on this small tablet screen, but for the doodler/artist it's good enough.Have not used the Photoshop feature much, so will not comment on photo editing. As I stated above, I was most interested in tablet for drawing capacity.As to using the pen as part of the software to annotate photos to attach to email etc.., it's easy to use. Not as much software out yet that takes advantage of drawing capacity, but device comes with enough software to do anything you would want to do. Results are equivalent to a sharpie marker.I find that I would rather type notes than use pen. So for me the pen is not that big of a deal for normal everyday operations.Rest of tablet features are like any Android. Plays back movies better than most and speakers front facing are better than the side ones I had on my Samsung Galaxy 7.0 Plus or the back ones on my Ipad 2 (which the carrying case covers).Quality of screen resolution is really really nice.I don't know why some reviews talk about flimsy build. Seem very sturdy to me. More than most tablets. Battery life is great.I would buy again.UPDATE 11-7-2012...............GREAT ABILITY TO CORRECT DRAWINGS........ Three things about using tablet for sketching ...1> I use the split screen function of tablet and have photo on one side and draw on other side.Small space but OK as can enlarge specific sections.2> Drawing on glass is strange. No grab like paper does to pen or pencil. I miss that feel.3> With real paper and pen or ink, it's hard to erase and if you work sketch much the paper becomes torn or smudged. WITH TABLET THE ERASING IS SIMPLE AND COMPLETE. I MEAN REALLY COMPLETE. I have produced better finished sketches because of this feature. A lot better. I can go and clean up all the over drawn lines with the erase feature and it erases at the same fine detail that pen draws at. Completely adjustable.  Making the pen and ink drawings flawless. The "undo" feature is also great for cleaning up drawing.All I can say is that drawing on tablet is different. I would never have considered that the ease of erasing and correcting would be such a great feature.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: zeeadarling
Reviews.Content: About me: I'm a 22 year old female. I'm an artist and I work 2 jobs where I am on the go a lot.  The note is a big help because I have nice little piece of technology to store ideas & checklists and check important emails with. I have had this tablet for about 4 weeks now.I bought this tablet because I was looking for a digital graphics tablet that was portable.  Originally I was seeing only tablets that were specifically for drawing and worked in addition to a computer. I wanted something thin, portable and easy to use.Main things I like and use it for:-Drawing out ideas with the pen and saving them to different folders to organize-Writing To Do Lists and ideas in my own hand writing. I like having them all in one place and not having to carry around folders and sketch books that will eventually fray and have pages fall out.-Surfing the internet away from home.- Checking balances and paying bills.-It has a nice map & navigation feature but I don't think either can work without internet connection, which is a downfall because if you're on the road and don't have it then it's useless.-I like planning with my calendar that comes with it, but I may try to find a different calendar app that let's me write with the pen and put little pictures on it to spruce it up.-Taking webcam pics daily and using the back camera to take pictures of my home cooked meals or quick snaps of things I made.-Reading. It comes with Nook. But what I am disappointed about with that is that it doesn't have every book that I want to read! You would think they would have everything. Kindle has a lending library that I wish Nook had something similar so I could check that out.A note about surfing the internet- It has a mobile view that has the more simplistic layout of websites for faster surfing, but you can also switch to desktop view to see the page in full like on a regular computer which is a great feature!So far it has served its purpose with very few glitches.  Lately I have been experiencing a glitch where the internet won't close out when I hit the x. Hopefully that will go away, it's not that big of an issue.The biggest issue I realized with it, is that flash is not supported on it.  This means that if there are games you want to play on a website or anything that supports flash and even videos you try to watch (not through the youtube app), you will be unable to see it.  The Note does come with a youtube & Netflix app so you can watch anything through it.  I would like for this device to support the Direct tv for mobile devices so I can watch normal programs through it too. That would be perfect!I really hope that in the future there will be drawing apps specifically for this tablet.  I have drawn a few things now with it on Snote [which is really just for ideas and sketches] and I am adjusting to its features.  What I am really hoping for is maybe a Photoshop type of app that you can do different layers with your artwork and add on masks and filters etc.  The ideal app would have what I just mentioned plus an array of brushes and tools where you can adjust pressure/lightness, smudge, sharpen and lighten/darken tools, and the feature where only your pen reacts to it. Because it's an issue when you're trying to draw but it's also registering your hand at the same time and the page will try to scroll or zoom.So far this has worked really great for my needs and I hope that there will be some advances that I can benefit from in the future. I want this product to take artwork a little more seriously and be able to run apps that have in depth drawing features.The Note becomes really comfortable and easy to use once you have a case for it.  It's very portable and just looks nice and I enjoy using it now that I have it customized.One other thing: I wish they had a longer than 1 year warranty that you don't have to pay for.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet out there
Reviews.Author: goodspeech
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best tablet out there.  I am an educational administrator and have to attend lots of meetings where I have to take lots of notes, review lots of documents and track lots of data.  The handwriting on this tablet is outstanding!!!!!  The ability to move between apps, documents and websites with the task manager keeps productivity at a max.  With the introduction of the split screen display, Samsung has raised the bar for all other tablets to follow.  It works seamlessly with websites, documents, handwriting apps, etc. I have used other tablets for several years and have waited for this one to hit the market.  Way to go Samsung!!!!!!Cons: need to be able to print to other printers besides Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: J Kim
Reviews.Content: Almost perfect with few possible things to enhance.1. No NFC2. Some Samsung recommended apps are not working (or links were dead).3. Samsung services require too many registrations and log ins.4. Although this device is Wi-fi only, isn't it possible to preload maps and enable it to be a navigator?*** UPDATEAfter I used this device for one week, I learned that my point #4 is no problem. You can use several "offline" navigation software which doesn't require realtime map downloading.BTW, the more I play with S pen, the more I love this device.If you get this device, don't forget to read S-pen instruction on a mini manual's "using the S pen" section. Further, when you type something, you should click set up for experiencing realtime input with your own handwriting on anywhere such as web browser address section, word processing software, etc. Also, find some info on S-memo usage. You can do a lot of things using the software in combination with S-pen.

Reviews.Title: Galaxy note tablet, limited comparison
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat new to tablets and android, I compare ipad 3's success in making up my mind.  Apple does a heck of a good job but I am usually an alternative shopper.  I bought the Note after a lot of comparing and some experience with android, I chose android for the common reason of apple users complaint of no internal storage options in the ipad, speaker location (volune and non-stereo), and apples pricing structures.  The Android system is sufficient in their software for my needs and I do like the idea of an open application market.  Now for the Samsung note tablet, I did not want to buy a prodect that was inferior to the new ipad and the price comparisons are both a bit pricey however that is what the market is, the Note is in line for price when compared to other products of this power and features (I looked hard at this).  I have had the Note for three weeks, the installed software meet my needs (impressed with the pri-installed word processer) and added some free apps, the screens are nice and easy to  personalise and make me feel at home, I don't seem to notice the lower resolution (1200 x 800 I think?) other people comment on although you can tell a slight difference if you compare very close but the color and smoothness of the overall display seem to negate the difference.  I have the 32gb version and am glad I went that way although I don't know that the 16gb model would be much of a problem because the 32gb micro sd card I have installed works flawlessly.  "Overall" I see no down side with this unit (wifi only), its quick, I like the processor and 2gb on board processer setup which is probably why its so quick.  Battery life is what they say it is, the 10.1" screen makes it bulky compared to a 7" (I also have a 7" kindle fire) but the extra bulk soon makes up for its size in ease of use along with easy on the eye.  I like having a 7" and 10" option but the premium experience is the 10" Note.  The Note does not hang up or act wierd, the good sound and speaker position is the plus they say it is, the kindle fire HD has a bit better sound and volume but the Note is a reasonable second and a no contest in head to head features of the note.  I agree with the more common view that the kindle fire is very good a streaming media experience but its use stops there, if you want to do much more than that the Note has gobs of more potential.  I like my old Kindle Fire and Fire HD, what would I do if stuck with only one? Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 Table is my recomendation and I havn't even explored the "pen" features.  I play a lot of media on the Note, it does a great job and when I want to do more its all right in my hands.  One more comment "on board storage" the note really has it (up to 64gb mini sd card and you can swap cards), I don't like my tablet telling me its out of space.

Reviews.Title: I never write reviews but
Reviews.Author: amaldonado
Reviews.Content: 1. Hardware: many people complain about the built quality of this tablet, I don't find anything wrong with it, I think its a good plastic (it doesn't bend unless you push it hard) and once you have it, you don't even notice it.2. Software: I also own a transformer prime and the iPad 3 ( I gave the iPad to my nephew after I bought the note 10.1). The transformer crashes all the time even with the official jelly bean. This tablet is the best I've ever had, it's very smooth, not laggy at all and most important apps and browser don't crash. I hope I will get the same features as the galaxy note 2 when it gets jelly bean ( If you don't know what I'm taking about check out some YouTube videos and you will see the awesomeness of the note 2).3. The S pen: To me it feels better than writing on a piece of paper, its very responsive with more than 1,024 levels of pressure sensitivity. I'm a college student so I use it in the classroom all the time, I only buy e-books so I dont have to carry around heavy textbooks, ebooks are  by far cheaper than textbooks. Also I can take notes directly on my ebooks and only see them when I need them. With the s pen app I can easily solve math problem just by writing the ecuation under the formula category of the app and I gives me the answer step by step and the graph if possible.This are reviews from people that own the tablet, if you are looking for the best android tablet in the market, this is one of the best options,  believe you won't regret.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing
Reviews.Author: Deusdies
Reviews.Content: I thought I should "settle" for this thing temporarily because I did not really like the specs (especially the screen resolution). I was waiting for my Transformer Infinity to arrive (which has a Full HD screen), so I thought I would use this in the meantime and return it once I get the Infinity. Worth noting also is that I was an owner of the new iPad.To sum up my review ahead: 20 days after my infinity arrived, the results are in: I kept the Note 10.1 and returned the infinity.Granted, the Infinity has a higher resolution screen (as does iPad 3) so it makes everything look sharp, but it loses on every other front. Persistent lag issues, quality control problems (I actually exchanged the Infinity 3 times before finally getting one that was "okay"), lag again, light bleeding, etc.The Note has absolutely no hardware problems. The S Pen is fantastic. The interface is the only OEM android skin that I actually like. The tablet is smooth and beautiful - I have come to prefer plastic over metal (both have its (dis)advantages though). The sounds on this thing is fantastic too. S Planner, S Note, a plethora of other apps that come with make the tablet experience full. Multiscreen? Heck yes! This is one of the reasons I sold my iPad - it was too limiting, couldn't really do much of productive work with it.This device would be the dream comes true if only it had a Full HD screen. But I am confident Samsung will come up with one soon.

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my gf as an anniversary gift and she absolutely loves it. She uses it everyday and rarely uses her laptop

Reviews.Title: What a great tablet.
Reviews.Author: AMDuser
Reviews.Content: Just a little update: 10/13/2012I am really happy with this tablet is can do so many things and do them really well. You have so many App.s that can be found at the Google Play store, many are free. I down loaded the Video player MX-Video there is a free App. and I can view my HD videos on this tablet and they really look great. I highly recommend that you buy the Sandisk 32gb Micro Ultra memory card. along with this Tablet and the Samsung to USB interface cable as it is easy to move your movies and pictures also Doc. files to your tablet using this cable.Also I can't say enough good things about Amazons quick quality service, it is just the best.My first thoughts:The Samsung 10.1 note is just a great tablet it has a great screen up front speakers it's easy to get setup and easy to learn to use. It has a quality build and is lite weight for a 10 inch tablet. Also the quick quality service you get from Amazon is a plus. I also have Logitech blue tooth Android wireless keyboard, this really helps with your typing when speed is needed.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet EVER!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: vickied2
Reviews.Content: In one word AWESOME!!!!!  I tried the Sony xperia twice. The first day it died, the next day after updates on the second  day wifi issues. But, this tablet is loaded with so much cool software you never get bored.. I can't get enough play time with it!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: I love it! It does almost everything I wanted and more. I will admit I was somewhat hesitant to purchase it, but I'm so glad I did. It does multitasking well and I can use it for two days without charging it if I don't use it excessively. The only thing that was frustrating to me was the issue between android and flash player. I'm a college student and I have a class that does homework online, the problem is that keyboard won't pop up. I'm guessing it's because the site is powered by flash player. Someone needs to develop an app like Photon the one for Ipad for androids. Other than that I've loved my experience with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Just got it and loving it!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ruby"
Reviews.Content: I got the Samsung Note the day before school started so I did not have much time to fiddle around with it.  Either way I took it to class and figured it out quite smoothly. I love this tablet, it is really great for students! I love the multiscreen function but I wish it allowed you to use all or more of the apps in that mode.  The S Note app is the best.  I use it religiously! I have really bad handwriting but surprisingly enough it is able to transfer my handwriting into text. I'm still learning everything on here little by little and it is really easy to use. I'm so glad I waited for this tablet because it is the best!

Reviews.Title: My first Samsung tablet from an IOS user
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "gpymd"

Reviews.Title: Innovative Tablet
Reviews.Author: subyfly
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this short because there's a lot in here have praised it properly. One thing is that I love the multi-tasking capability as this was was one of the few things I've kept away from tablets all this time. Being an IT Manager, I'm a power user and I've tried 3 different tablets including an iPad. Out of those tablets I've used in the past, the iPad came close to being my main device to manage an infrastructure when I'm away but still wasn't a true "multi-tasking" device.And then I saw this device and heard and seen the capabilities and I can see myself connected to my email and having my browser up and running on the other end and managing my servers through the browser. Now I didn't get the Note 10.1 from Amazon but through my Vendor but thought I would share my experience anyways.One thing that was a flaw from the moment I opened and turned it on is that my screen had a pretty decent size of a cluster of dead pixels. So I'll be exchanging it immediately. I did think about getting the Asus Infinity TF700 but was hearing LOTS of flaws and Quality of the design.  So hopefully my Note is just a small flaw and a replacement isn't going to have the same problem, otherwise the device is very speedy and with 2GB of Ram, should be some sort of future proof.I would definitely consider and recommend this product to anyone who are multi-task. I still have my new iPad but have forgotten and have not turned it on since. It now belongs to my wife. However, I use my Macbook Air 2012 and ThinkPad x220 for my daily use.

Reviews.Title: An all around nice tablet, with some minor uh-ohs!
Reviews.Author: Phoj
Reviews.Content: I purchased the iPad 2 when it was released and owned that for about 10 months before it fell and the screen cracked.  I decided to go to the Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 as I have as of late enjoyed the android interface much more than the simplicity and lack of design Apple puts out.  To be honest, the sanctions against the first tab provoked me to buy it.  I figured it must piss off Apple enough to some degree so I thought it must be pretty good. I couldn't imagine they would go to court over garbage.The tab 2 was nice, but was lacking in hardware so after a few months I upgraded to this one, the Note 10.1I did quickly notice a performance boost as well as improved useability as for the smoothness of the interface.  Things feel less clunky than with the Tab 2.Overall it is very similar; primarily hardware boosted.  I do like the new styllus abilities as well as the opportunity to multi screen.  It doesn't compare to my desktop and 3 large monitors, but it's still nice to have.The device feels a little fragile.  I am terrified of it falling on accident and breaking open.  That is one thing the ipad seems to have over Samsung is the devices seem a little more resistant to trauma.  The backside of the Note seems to have a slight bump in the middle, as if whatever it is inside was to big for the back panel to go on firmly without resistanct.  Not a big deal in my mind, but not ideal either.My ending conclusiong for my brief review is that the Galaxy Note is a very nice tablet.  My only real complaint is the inability to find a nice case for it; everything I find seems to be cheap and/or garbage.It runs nicely, has a pretty good battery 5+ hours, and is pleasant on the eyes aesthetically and resolution wise.I would recommend this as a very good alternative to the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Great piece of hardware, but lacks software
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: The good:I love the S-Pen and the precision with which the software recognizes my handwriting.The Split Screen functionality is cool.Being able to make handwritten notes on PDF's and DOCX files is one of the main reasons I bought the tablet, and the tablet works well for this.  I tested out my friend's IPAD (not sure what version) and his device's ability to recognize my writing doesn't even come close to the accuracy exemplified by the Galaxy Note.The bad:No Flash support.  Thus, I cannot watch Amazon Prime TV/Movies, nor can I access some of the other web pages I frequent.  This was one advantage over the IPAD I greatly looked forward to, but Flash is not available on this device.*Update October 19On the FLASH PLAYER:There are several ways to get around not having flash player.  I tried downloading a release of flash from the Adobe site that was supposed to work with Ice Cream Sandwich (the factory install) but couldn't install it.  One of the problems- Every time I clicked on any link/button to install flash, the device would take me to the play store and tell me flash wasn't available.I eventually found an application that requires flash, downloaded it, and let it install flash automatically, thus bypassing all automatic links to the google play store.However, once flash player is installed, it still doesn't work as well as a PC with the sites I frequent (rosetta stone, amazon).  And, what is worse, in order to keep the flash player working, I had to disable the automatic updates for the device.  I had the unfortunate luck of waking up one morning with the tablet telling me it had updated the software, and after this happened no amount of work I could do would get the flash player working again.  So, I restored to factory settings and have not agreed to the TOS of the software update, and my flash player has continued working.MULTISCREEN:The multiscreen option of the tablet is neat, but it has two major drawbacks.  One:  you can only have one window of each of the compatible programs open at a time (so, you can't have two Polaris office items open at once) and there are relatively few programs that are compatible with the multiscreen.  Being able to have class notes open in one window and e-mail open in another is nice.  I can open a PDF with polaris office (although  the PDF reader doesn't have near the quality of interaction with the Spen as the Document reader) and have a google document open with the web browser, but this isn't ideal.  It would be nice to have Adobe and Polaris going at the same time, but this cannot be done yet.Of course, it is easy to switch between active programs, and both Polaris and Adobe remember where you left off, so once I was used to navigating the android device switching between applications wasn't too bad.  Not as good as Alt+Tab, but a close secondBLUETOOTH KEYBOARDI think a bluetooth keyboard is a must.  I have the logitech keyboard/case which is designed for the galaxy tab w/o the SPEN (This was a buying mistake on my end) and it works great with what I have, even if not the way I had originally envisioned.  Until I discovered the "Null Keyboard" app, I wasn't happy with the interaction between the two devices because the on-screen keyboard would pop up whenever I tapped a text box.  Now, I can't see working on the tab w/o the external keyboard.AS IT NOW STANDS I am much happier with the device, but still think that the software could be developed more.  I am close to upgrading my rating to 4 stars, but until the flash issue is worked out (or the sites I use release an android app) I am more inclined to leave my rating where it is.

Reviews.Title: Totally pleased
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Algomoar"
Reviews.Content: First let me say that it is my first tablet, but is totally awesome, is fast, some online reviews talk about the plastic cover (I don't care about it) and about the screen resolution (true is low, but is just like my first laptop), but let's be honest, if I would like to see something on HD, I would have used my TV (not even my laptop). The S-pen is great, I use to take notes in my class and I think I'm not going back to paper (trees cheer in the background).

Reviews.Title: Stuck with lemon tablet
Reviews.Author: A. Riel
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the note 2 10.1 from the tab 2 10.1 as my previous tablet was damaged beyond repair. The old tablet had its issues with freezing up after the last update along with not enough ram. The note 2 10.1 has twice the ram as the tab model. The continual problems I have had with the note is that the left side of the touch screen lacks sensitivity when using the virtual keyboard. This is a pain when your typing and find out autocorrect won't predict words correctly because it didn't sense you touching the letter selected.Moving on to the S pen. The sensitivity of the pen continually changes. Some of the time it will select the link you are trying to open in a web browser and the other times it will select another link close to the tip because it's not tracking correctly. I have changed tips from the rubber tip to the hard nylon type tip due to the rubber tip wearing out. There are articles online about adjusting the sensitivity but evidently I have the only pen that doesn't respond to adjustments.Samsung hasn't been interested in providing solutions to screen sensitivity along with the pen issues. They said to return it back to sam's club, sam's club says to contact Samsung instead. The finger pointing isn't doing anything to fix the problem so my solution is to use it as a second paperweight and go buy a different brand tablet. I like Samsung and their features offered but customer service needs improvement if they plan to keep customers.Anyone have suggestions for a mid level Ipad that would function for work and personal use? I use my current note 2 10.1 for work and personal use daily. I need reliability and function. I know little about Apple products. Suggestions welcome.

Reviews.Title: Samsung never lets you down
Reviews.Author: Barbara Craig "Barbii"
Reviews.Content: Last year I got the Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 for my birthday from the hubbins and I use it constantly, from books, music, recipes, docs, games, you name it, it never leaves my side. Yesterday I ordered the Samsung Galaxy Note as a gift for him...it arrived super speedy today. Great packaging and it is being charged now. On November 9th 2011 he was in a horrible motorcycle accident and spends a lot of time in bed with his back injuries so this will be very handy for him. He will be able to do his brain games on it, set appointments, read and so much more, all while being comfy instead of having to boot up the monster desk top pc. I will continue with updates, pros and cons as he uses it, though I don't see many cons as we are a samsung family from our smart phones, tvs and now two tabs. I am quite anxious though to see this S pen at work and all the nifty features with the Samsung Galaxy Note. So far pros are....1. Super Fast delivery (thank you Amazon)2. Safe and secure packaging3. Nice priceMore to come over the weekend once we get into it more

Reviews.Title: Beware... Prime members!
Reviews.Author: Theodore B. Carvlho
Reviews.Content: I'm a Prime member and this device does not support Amazon's free down load movies...Amazon's selling page does not mention this shortcoming!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great for Teachers
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I teach in a university. For the past several years, I was teaching in a university where they have smart boards or smart podiums in every classrooms. I could write on the desktop monitor connected to an overhead projector. I could save the notes and posted them online for the students to download. Recently I moved to another university where they don't have smart boards or smart podiums. I needed something that allowed me to write and save the lecture notes. I looked around and even tried a graphic tablet which didn't work well. I then tried this Galaxy Note and it is exactly what I needed. Not as good as a dedicated smart board or smart podium but gets the job done. On top of that I can just use it to connect to the internet, etc. The downside is that you need to buy a 30-pin to HDMI adaptor and then a HDMI-to-VGA adaptor to connect to the overhead projector. There probably is an easier way but I didn't have the time to look around because I needed to use it right away. It would have been great if this Galaxy Note has a HDMI output but that would probably not fit into the ultra-slim profile. Overall, I love this unit especially the S pen feature.

Reviews.Title: I'm in love with it
Reviews.Author: Linda Martinez
Reviews.Content: I'm legally blind and have a kindle fire 7" hd for reading but difficult for me go searching on the Web so I did search for a bigger one. For the price i decided for thi one and believe me is very easy to install and do more than i expected. I hardly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, awesome, awesome
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Austin "Don't tell God how big the ...
Reviews.Content: fast processor, clear and bright screen. The handwriting feature takes some getting used to but it works great, especially combined with the auto-correct feature.

Reviews.Title: Does everything and more
Reviews.Author: Richard  Owens
Reviews.Content: I have owned this for months now and learning new things it can do everyday. One really neat option is to use it to schedule television shows and even changes my tv with the infrared beam. It's probably the best purchase I have made in years.

Reviews.Title: real good for clearance price
Reviews.Author: Egg
Reviews.Content: If they're still available its definitely worth the price.  Even though the ne one has a "better" screen,  I dont see how this one needs to be better.

Reviews.Title: Sa,simg Galaxy Note 10.1
Reviews.Author: Carol Jackson
Reviews.Content: I continued to wonder if I should order an Apple Ipad or the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1.  When I read some of the reviews for the Galaxy I felt this would be the note pad for me and low and behold it was.  The colors on the screen areso bright.  There are many adjustments you can make to custom fit your desires. It takes a while to figure out where everything is, however when you do it is a breeze.  I am very happy with my Samsung and enjoy it every morning whether I am trading stocks with it, looking a the local events or checking out the newest movies.It is a great item and I have told many of my friends that I recommend this tablet for all ages..

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Tim's girl
Reviews.Content: This is a great Tablet... The size of the screen is perfect! and it has quite a bit o memory. The only downsides are, no USB port No HDMI port, and it doesn't support the amazon prime app.Also I bought the USB adapter cord and it doesn't recognize the USB...

Reviews.Title: Bellísima!!! Súper Tecnología
Reviews.Author: Janeth
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous! super TechnologyExcelente!!! Gracias Amazon, todas las veces que he realizado compras, responden por la mercancía vendida. Todo llega en perfecto estado y si se da el caso de algún improvisto ellos responden.Respecto a la tableta es de excelente calidad, una maravilla, tecnología de primera. La recomiendo 100%. Compren con seguridad.Excellent! Thanks Amazon, all the times I've made ​​purchases, account for goods sold. Everything comes in perfect condition and if for some unexpectedly given them respond.Regarding the tablet is of excellent quality, wonderful, technology first. I recommend it 100%. Buy with ease.

Reviews.Title: Replacement for the Galaxy Tab 2
Reviews.Author: Helen
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my Galaxy Tab 2 was not waterproof. I was not able to salvage it after I spilled water on it (yes, I tried the rice trick)I had the Galaxy Tab for almost 3 years and if I wouldn't have ruined it, I wouldn't be replacing it. If you are thinking of purchasing the Tab over the Note, it's a good option and less $$. However, even though I was mostly happy with the Tab 2, I decided to purchase the Note 10.1 this time around mainly for the quad-core processor. The s-pen is a neat feature but not a selling point and to date I haven't used it much more than to play around with it. I do a lot of photography with my DSLR camera and like to be able to store many pictures on my tablet. I do not use the tablet for picture taking. The quality is ok if all you plan on doing with your photos is posting on social media.I've read reviews where some say the resolution isn't as clear as other tablets. The Note 10.1 and the Tab 2 have the same resolution and it is very crisp and clear. I have no complaints. I almost bought the 2014 edition of the Note 10.1 solely for the fact that it claims to have a crisper resolution. However, I opted to save a few $$ and I have no complaints. I have to note, that I purchased this tablet without having seen it first and when I was comparing the 2014 version, I didn't see that either. So, I can't say if there's a noticeable difference in the 2 screens.The tablet is fast, resolution is great and does what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: My precious baby ♥
Reviews.Author: D.A. Maxwell
Reviews.Content: This was almost everything I was hoping for! It works like a breeze, is quicker than any of my computers, smooth, GORGEOUS graphics, and I love the S-pen. I use this tablet to read books, work on stories, draw, take notes, make lists, document travel, and watch short videos, and it works well for everything I need. Great to take when traveling or finishing up a few quick things before bed!Downsides:- PS Touch is... weird? When I use the S-Pen on PS Touch my lines come out weirdly pixellated. I don't have this problem on any of the other art apps I installed. Sticking to Sketchbook, I think.- I can't copy large chunks of text from Polaris to other word processors, which is irritating when I'm writing.- The autocorrect doesn't... well, autocorrect. It offers a likely alternative, but you have to actually hit it to make it fix your typos, which really slows down writing.

Reviews.Title: poor battery
Reviews.Author: easydoesit
Reviews.Content: The tablet is great, other than taking 12 hours or more to charge the battery each time. Samsung has a problem and needs to step up to the plate and fix it. I don't use many apps, and don't leave things running. There is no reason for it to take so long to charge, especially when I turn it off to charge. Without the charging problem, I would give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: WIFI stopped working from time to time
Reviews.Author: Tom Liu
Reviews.Content: The WIFI stopped working from time to time, and the only way to resolve the WIFI connection issue is to do a factory reset, which will remove all data on the tablet. I had the tablet for about two weeks, and had to do factory reset three times.I liked the tablet and wanted to keep it, but it's just too much time to spend on fixing the WIFI connection issue, and i am not able to afford the time anymore. Unfortunately i had to return the tablet, which cost me more than two hours (packing the product, drove to UPS and dropped off the box).

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet
Reviews.Author: asmaa makhoukhi
Reviews.Content: I had the Galaxy 2 10.1 tablet and then I upgraded to the note 10.1 and by far this is the best tablet you can own, amazing speed, amazing screen resolution, light weight and good size. This is the best tablet.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great for students
Reviews.Author: Colt
Reviews.Content: Got this for Christmas last year and a year later it still rocks! I use it for notes all the time in school. If you are in class a lot I would recommend. It is light and quick to look things up. Notes are easy to take and the handwriting feature is a bonus and it looks close to my real writing style. It takes some getting used to for sure.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous tablet.
Reviews.Author: J. R. Luciano "Librery Cat"
Reviews.Content: Fabulous tablet. Yes, this is one of my best adquisitions in Amazon.com. This tablet makes almost everything you can desire in this kind of electronic tool. It's potent, quick, has beautiful screen, very good sound and a large amount of apps pre-installed. Besides you have the play-store and Samsung store with a lot of apps every day.

Reviews.Title: I like it but...
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: I received this tablet as a gift for my birthday. Im pleased with it for the most part but there are things that really irritate me about this tablet. Here they are:1. The microphone for the tablet is located at the bottom where the charging port is. Very annoying. When I skype with friends and family they tell me that my voice sounds "muffled". The only way they can hear me clearly is if I hold the tablet, which brings me to my next problem.2. I bought a little case for the tablet which props it up so I dont have to hold it. I really love the case but when the tablet sits up right the microphone is covered. When it lays flat no one can see me. When I turn it sideways so it is in portrait mode the person in which I am skyping cuts in half. I dont know if that is a tablet thing or a skype app thing but the tablet doesnt adjust to the change. When it is upside down (camera at the bottom, microphone at the top) it works but then whoever im skyping with is practically looking up my nose. I dont like it.3. The battery runs down even when Im not using it. When I had my ipad I could turn it off and leave it for a couple of days and the battery would barely go down. This tablet acts more like a computer (I have to shut it down every night or when I'm not using it)4. The tablet comes preloaded with roughly 1GB of apps I DONT WANT!! There is no way to delete them unless you "root" your tablet (I looked on YouTube for how to do it and it's a process. Not to mention the damage that could be caused if a mistake is made)5. I specifically wanted this tablet because I thought it would be very useful for school (I'm a junior in college). I really like taking notes my tablet but I'm irritated by the lack of printing options. There aren't any! When I tried to print my boarding pass it gave me an error saying "Can only print using a Samsung Printer". Seriously??? This tablet brand new costs almost as much as a new ipad and I'm restricted to only using a Samsung printer? I'm very unhappy about that.6. When watching a review about the tablet I saw that you can hand gesture and the keyboard splits in half. I can't get mine to do it. I have tried over and over. It just doesn't work for me.In the long run I like the tablet. I'm not a very picky person and I can look past these defects since it was a gift. I would have definitely given it 5 stars if it werent for those tablet manufacturing errors. I personally wouldnt drop $400+ of my own money on it but since it was a gift Im okay with it.

Reviews.Title: Great value after price drops.
Reviews.Author: Techno geek
Reviews.Content: Excellent performance for the price now that it's old enough for discounts.  The S-Pen is surprisingly useful for Ebook annotation and scrolling.  Battery life is exceptional.Paired it with a bluetooth keyboard and it worked flawlessly.  I just wish it used a standard min-usb plug like other tablets.

Reviews.Title: Minor complaints; overall GREAT tablet
Reviews.Author: Robyn Allegra "I love to read but sometimes h...
Reviews.Content: This tablet is magnificent! The stylus works very well. You definitely want to get a cover to protect it though. My only complaints are that 1) there is no USB drive (but of course it's too thin to have one) and 2) it can only print to Samsung printers.Thankfully there are ways to get around both of these: 1) You can purchase an adapter (like the OEM Samsung 30-Pin to USB Adapter for Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 / 10.v / 8.9) which will allow you to use USB-powered devices and 2) The Samsung people told me that you can download apps in the Play Store for your printer. I have downloaded an HP app but haven't had a chance to use it yet. Will update this review once I do.

Reviews.Title: Seems to work well
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife's birthday, she told me she's not into gadgets but she absolutely loves this. I haven't had a chance to play with it but it seems pretty good. I'll make her a "gadget-girl" yet..

Reviews.Title: Sweet Mother of God
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet is my dream come true. Seriously fast and easy to use if you have Android. The on board apps are w/e but I guess they'd be more of use for someone who actually uses their tab for media. I use it for school and taking notes is so nice and smooth and easy. Pulling out the stylus makes a special menu open so you can access the specific apps that particularly use it. I bought mine used, had some dings on the corner, like 1 scratch that you can't even tell, I got this baby at a bargain. FTW

Reviews.Title: Best tablet EVER!
Reviews.Author: Vickie B
Reviews.Content: This is the best tablet I have ever used! I have had a kindle fire, a nexus 7, a galaxy tab 10.1, and I have a surface RT. This tablet is by far the best I have ever used! I have used an Ipad, and this beats it, by far. Samsung went far and beyond with the apps that come preloaded on the 10.1. It came with S note, Photoshop Touch, Video Editor, and many other great apps. The function of the S pen is a beautiful thing. There is no lag time while using the pen. I could talk days on end about the awesome functions, but I will end with saying that if you are tablet shopping, this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: College student - Refurbished
Reviews.Author: Jordan Tran
Reviews.Content: I have been on the fence on which "tablet" to buy debating whether an iPad, Samsung Chromebook, or this Note 10.1 would suffice my class needs. I am applying for pharmacy school so this purchase was a great investment. Comparing to the iPad, the Note's multitasking capabilities as well as the S-pen features are great reasons to make this purchase! I bought this refurbished for $300 and nothing was wrong with it.I have a Samsung Galaxy phone so keeping everything "Android" does make everything much more easier.I prefer the Note over the iPad anyday because of how MUCH more it can do for me as a student!

Reviews.Title: Nicest Android tablet I've used to date
Reviews.Author: Joleen Shook "-J. Shook"
Reviews.Content: super fast, crisp clear graphics, not tons of pre-installed stupidity.  Very very good value for the price, and I love the added bonus of the pen for jotting notes and drawing.  I bought one of these for my Mom... will be getting one for myself in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Áslaug E Grétarsdóttir
Reviews.Content: A very good product. I'm very happy with it. I didn't want Ipad like the majority but I haven't found anything lacking, I also bought the kingston bluetooth keyboard case as well and these two things work very well together.

Reviews.Title: Way better then the Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Mccwho
Reviews.Content: IT is serious table meant to do real work not games only, this is a tool not a toy.IT is way better then the kindle HD, or my friends Kindle fire. It does play HD videos, IT may not have the technically specific resolution of HD, but honestly on such a small screen your eyes will not see the difference. To bad for Amazon that they wont allow you to watch HD videos with your Prime account. I am cancelling my Prime account and going with Netflix, at least I can watch theirs in HD.

Reviews.Title: Great gift.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband and he loves it. Enough that he is considering swapping his phone for a galaxy as well.

Reviews.Title: Flawless
Reviews.Author: Byron
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet, with alotta horsepower under the hood, and some features that no one else has as many have pointed out here.Mainly I wanted to post that I bought a refurb from BigOutlet, through Amazon(with Prime shipping :) ) for $299.Was as new, works flawlessly, and came with everything, including extra tips for the pen.Best deal around for a tablet IMO.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, good quality.
Reviews.Author: ZuMi
Reviews.Content: Product is as described by seller. Excellent product, would recommend it to everyone, especially businessmen/women. Great size, high internet speed, and you can multitask with different applications at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Great Product if you want an Android Operating System
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Kent T"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet to replace a IPAD.  This was considerable cheaper and I like the android operating system better.  Of course its due to the fact that I have been an Android phone user for years so I understand that operating better then I do Apple which the only Apple product I had was an IPAD.  This has been absolutely fantastic tablet.  I love the removable flash drive and the ease at which I can update pictures, music, and videos.  I just remove the memory, slip it into my computer, upload and put it back in my tablet and it works great.  Sure saves the hassle of dealing with Itunes too.  I have purchased music from both Amazon as well as Google, and makes it a better experience.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jean B.
Reviews.Content: I have researched tablets for a while and when my neighbor brought over his Galaxy Note 10.1 I was totally fascinated by the number of functions it was capable of. I then went to my area Best Buy and played with a few more models and nothing compared to the Samsung. I came home and ordered it that day!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 - An Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I received this tablet as a gift (not purchased through Amazon.com) one week ago. Prior to that I had played with one for about a week and a half, and I knew this was the tablet for me. I absolutely LOVE it. Writing with the S-Pen is smooth and enjoyable. It's also very enjoyable to use the pen instead of the finger on the touch screen and for typing on the touch-screen keyboard. However, for extended typing, a bluetooth keyboard would probably be better. All in all, I absolutely love this tablet. Google Now is creepily accurate and innovative, and I'm enjoying getting used to the other features. I chose to write this review because when I was considering what tablet to purchase, reviews were a big factor in my decision (then the decision was made for me). I chose to stick with the 10.1" model rather than the newer 8" model because I like the bigger screen size, it allows much more room for S-Pen input, and because the 10.1" model comes with Photoshop Touch pre-installed. The 8" does not. The 10.1" also has the same software update as the 8", so it's essentially the same thing, only bigger. The price is definitely on the high end of tablets, but ultimately you have to consider what it is you're looking for. This is the first tablet I've owned, but I've done a considerable amount of research, and this tablet is the best on the market for stylus input and handwriting recognition. If that is important to you, you should consider purchasing this tablet.I am not affiliated with Samsung or Amazon in any way.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: biff441 "biff"
Reviews.Content: Instead of upgrading my old desktop computer, I decided to give a tablet a try. I do not regret it. I access the internet via wifi and it has worked flawlessly. The screen is bright and refreshingly HD quality viewing. The processor is very fast and opening multible apps on one screen is smooth and convenient. One issue I was concerned about was the ability to print to my HP printer. With HP ePrint, it is a breeze. I was even able to load all my favorites from IE and Firefox. Unless you are needing a gaming PC, desktops will be filed with the Edsel. Tablets are the future. This Samsung unit is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: The best tablet
Reviews.Author: Vicente Santorsola
Reviews.Content: I review the ipad before decide for it. Simply amazing, very productive, nice to use with spen, fast, battery last a lot, i recommend this purchase

Reviews.Title: Awesome performance, decent build quality and versatile
Reviews.Author: Gehan Ranawana
Reviews.Content: Don't have a single regret on buying this device, well except for hoping that Samsung would one of these days use some steel and make a device with a premium finish!!Pros:- Excellent performance: I've experienced no lag at all with this device. It runs even the latest app/game in the market without even a hitch. Multi-tasking works like a charm. Of course, you got to remember that when you run two apps side-by-side, you really can't expect the same level of smoothness as when running just a single app.- This device is amazingly versatile. The main reason I bought this specific device was due to the integration of the stylus. Using the stylus, this device adds multiple levels of additional productivity to most of the activities you could perform with the device.- Even after a year of having purchased this device, still I find it difficult to find a direct competitor to this device.Cons:- I rally wish that Samsung would build at least some of their top-end devices with a more premium finish!! This also holds true for this device. Even though, the device does not feel fragile or cheap to the touch, still, the build of the device could have been much better.- Screen resolution. Wish the screen packed a bit more pixels to give it a higher resolutionWould recommend for anyone looking for a good Android Tab. I would say that this is still one of THE BEST Android Tablets that are available at the moment.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: William Smith
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, I held out for a long time on getting a tablet... to me they just seemed like an overpriced toy.  It wasn't until I used a friend's Note that I realized this could actually be useful for business as well as theocratic purposes.  I've used it for both during meetings several times now, and taking notes on it is more than realistic, its just like paper!  With, of course, the added benefit of being able to keep all your notes electronic.  Besides note taking, its a great device for study, research and yes, even playing (it even controls my TV, too cool!)  I've had several geek outs over the last few days, and I'm delighted with this tablet.  I did go with the refurb model, and the tablet itself came just like new, no problems.  However, the company that fulfilled the order for Amazon sent the wrong charging cable.  I went on a 6 store quest to find the right one, finally getting one that worked at the corporate Verizon store.  Word to the wise, even if the charger fits and says its for Samsung tables, don't walk out of the store until you've tried plugging it in and charging the tablet!  I got a red X on the battery when I tried to use a charger from Best Buy, 'el cheapo!As far as useful apps, here's a few I found:Lecture Notes - use instead of the S Note app that comes with the Note, its worth the 5 bucks!ezPDF Reader - great for studying literature and annotatingDropBox - sync files between devices and your computer if you use with the tabletI highly recommend this tablet if you're in the market.  I haven't used iPad at all, but I know this has quite a few features that iPad does not, including the stylus, active touchscreen, multi-window support and easy access to the file system.  Oh yeah, and I installed FireFox and Adobe Flash for the full Internet experience... try that on an Apple device!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: tvsteglich
Reviews.Content: Received the product on time. It works perfectly, very smooth, good video, sound, really love the S Pen. I will be using it with online applications to run my business and so far the trial runs have been flawless. Our maintenance department will be outfitted with them as well. This is a nice tablet and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Chuck Zendner "Doc Zee"
Reviews.Content: The first one I bought stopped working after 3 days. The replacement unit is so cool. I have had this for about a month now and use it every day.Amazon's replacement procedure was amazingly fast. I had my new one a few days after letting Amazon know there was a problem.

Reviews.Title: This is a good little machine
Reviews.Author: Jerry Cummings
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot of good comments about this tablet, but for me, the jury is out until I get one in my hot little hands.  It's in my hands now and I like it!  It's very fast and I really think the screen resolution and clarity of display is very good!  It's also very light, and lighter than my iPad (4th gen).I feel this is a product worth considering as an alternative to the iPad (starting with cost) and you can do a lot with it.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: German Campos
Reviews.Content: It surpassed my expectations. Great battery life and performance. The handwriting recognition works excellent, same to say about the multitasking.

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Note 10.1
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I love it, and my family does too. Works flawlessly on browser,  and the screen is crystal clear.  I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: James Brown
Reviews.Content: Fantastic all round tablet - I actually bought it mainly to replace a full tablet PC, and have yet to find the perfect app that can replace the vector capacity of Illustrator.. So still looking! But the tablet itself is excellent

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Wild4
Reviews.Content: still loading information and music to it. sync the product to my pc with ease. love the ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Love the tablet
Reviews.Author: LeenyBean
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet - it's great.The only things that surprised me were that multiscreen only works with samsung apps (that I know of)

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Carol Ann Inciso
Reviews.Content: I love this product. Beats my I pad easy to use fast . I would recommend this over an I pad does so much more ?

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: atask
Reviews.Content: this tablet is great for writing, drawing and study. The S-pen works really good. You can do much more things than with an ipad.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: Darion
Reviews.Content: I am actually typing this review on my tablet. I have been through only one tablet, the HP Touchpad. So my experience is limited when it comes to tablets, but you shouldn't disregard my input because I am tech guy who has always been into electronics. So I made sure that I would not make the same mistake again. I did extensive research over and over again. I was originally going to choose the Asus Transformer Infinity due to the FullHD but changed my mind when I learned it crashes a lot of the time. I went with the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 because I heard it rarely does that. I have had it for a week now, and still no crash. Even when I am doing so many things on this. It is smooth, fast, nice looking, and has the S-Pen. If you're looking for a tablet, this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Bye bye Apple Ipad
Reviews.Author: Kunal Dhar
Reviews.Content: I've been using the new Ipad and am very disappointed with it - especially with it overheating during movies. The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 is lighter, runs much smoother and is a more functional device in my opinion. Android is just a better platform as I don't get stuck having to buy apps and media from Apple. Much easier to copy, add and edit files on the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1. I have now switched into being a loyal Android and Samsung customer. I seriously disagree with the reviews about the build quality as I simply find them completely untrue. It is a great looking, multi-tasking and high-performing tablet. Best on the market right now in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: S Pen, Worth it or not?
Reviews.Author: Ehsan Kamalinejad
Reviews.Content: I bought my note 10.1 about 2 weeks ago and since then I have been using it all the time. This is a very capable device and as benchmarks suggest nearly everything is running smoothly on it. I know that most of you are interested to compare note 10.1 with iPad. I also have an iPad and I have been testing many things on both devices. While note 10.1 is better on Google based apps. iPad has slightly superior edge on most of the similar apps (just slightly). But the final word here is the S Pen. If you want to get this tablet for anything except the pen, don't do it and go for other tablets with better resolution/price/etc. However, if you care about taking notes or/and sketching, note 10.1 is a must have. I can not express how much I like taking notes on my note 10.1 and if you want to compare note 10.1 to iPad from productivity point of view iPad is not even close imo. Just try to sketch something on 10.1 and you understand how good it feels. Now I don't need to carry anything except my 10.1 to any lecture that I go to. This will save me a lot of time later for finding the notes too.Cons:- The screen resolution could be better.- Jelly Bean is still not available on it (Samsung recently announced that it will be released on note 10.1 soon).Pros:- S Pen works just great.- Generally smooth and powerful.- Easy to hold and very light/thin.- Samsung S Pen apps (in particular double screen features) are very useful.Overall this is one of the best devices I have ever bought and I highly recommend it for anyone who has any task related to note taking or sketching.

Reviews.Title: Im obsessed
Reviews.Author: Stacey Hovland
Reviews.Content: I have had my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 for a whole week now and I haven't found anything that I cant use it for. (Except as a babysitter-no wait, there are apps for that). From work (taking meeting notes, dropbox for presentations and synching all of my emails both work and personal ) to real life ( S note meal planning, reading on every available app). The S note feature was what got me sold on this tablet. I had my eye on a kindle but decided to bite the bullet and invest because of the ability to read nook, kindle, and google mediums.One particular thing I love is that it has so much to offer but there are tutorials everywhere. They usually annoy me but with something that does it all, I like that it knows that I am kinda a dummy... SAMSUNG IS MAGICAL

Reviews.Title: love, love, love this!
Reviews.Author: marilyn s hines
Reviews.Content: I wish there were more than 5 stars to rate this item! I can do so many things with this tablet, it is like a mini version of my desktop computer, only better! There isn't a day that goes by that I don't grab it for something. The battery seems to stay charged a good amount of time, even connected to wi-fi for hours of game play and FaceBook searching. I have not timed the charging wait time, but itdoesn't seem to take long. You can use it while it is charging, so you don't have to be without it. It stays connected well to my wi-fi, which is never more than 50 feet away in any room I choose to be in at home. The on-screen keyboard has nice sized keys for my fat fingers. It came with popular software and plenty of space for all the apps I have downloaded, as well as the thousands of pictures I have taken with the front and rear cameras, and over 200 songs I downloaded--and I haven't even put a memory card in it yet, which you can add, but it did not come with. I also purchased a wireless keyboard for it and it works well with it. I also use it as an eReader and it works wonderfut with both text and audio books. It is set up exactly like my Samsung Gallaxy smartphone, so transitioning between them is easy.

Reviews.Title: Pretty awesome little tablet
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I bought this for school. I researched a bunch of tablets, and everything said this was a pretty strong tablet with really good note-taking abilities (I should hope so, it's called the NOTE). It really is pretty awesome. You can write math equations into the note app and it'll solve them, same with chemistry symbols, and the pen feature works really well. Much better than I've found in a few others I tested out.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Nora Janvier
Reviews.Content: Took a long time researching tablet options...I was looking for more than 16gb and ability to use expanded memory via sd cards. Under 400 dollars.and umm Not a "fruit". This is perfect. Does all I need  it to plus alot of unexpected perks like s note. Great buy..you won't regret it. Light, smooth, sleek, easy to use. I use samsung phones and love their products.  Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: outstanding
Reviews.Author: Matthew Sweeney
Reviews.Content: Love this, way better than an ipad. Highly recommend this item. The s pen is pretty cool feature as well.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: juan miguel martinez
Reviews.Content: This tablet is so cool,I love it because I pay less than 300 dollars so is worth it. Yes

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a Valentines Gift
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My husband allowed me to order this for a Valentines gift. When I ordered this from Used i was hesitant. The seller itsjustdon, described it better than perfectly. I got in in flawless condition at a fraction of the cost of new. It works, no scratches, nothing missing, has included case/cover with it! I have been using this everyday since getting this. Ive always wanted this product since seeing this and now i finally have it! I love it!

Reviews.Title: Had this for 7 months and this is a great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Mike J.
Reviews.Content: No problems or issues as a refurbished tablet. Shipped securely with adequate padding. Came with charging cord. Tablet works just as well as new tablet without the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Best Decision I Ever Made!
Reviews.Author: leah antkiewicz
Reviews.Content: I had the original iPad and it was slowly dying a painful death so I wanted to get a new tablet. I did a ton of research on whether to get the new iPad or branch out to an Android device. I decided to go the Android way because it was cheaper and I like how Android gives you more flexibility. The Note had good reviews and I liked the fact that it had the stylus so I decided to take a chance on it. BEST DECISION EVER! This tablet is very powerful. I hardly ever use my laptop anymore. I can do everything on the Note. It's great for taking notes, watching Netflix, browsing the web, etc. Streaming Netflix was impossible from my last device and with this one it's no problem. I also have to read a lot of papers for school and it's easy for me to download the PDF and write my notes directly on the PDF and save them, allowing me to skip printing all together. It's fast and the battery life so far is great. I highly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: What a Great Device!
Reviews.Author: Annalise Lowry
Reviews.Content: As I type out this review on said tablet, I will behonrst and say this was not my first choice. I had originally wanted the 2014 edition, but the price difference was what sold me (also, I got this tablet on a sick deal with Amazon on Black Friday during a Lighting Deal). The price was attractive and once I got it, I fell in love with it. The virtual keyboards are just right in size, the handeriting option is amazing, and I love binge watching on Netflix because of the larger screen. I am so happy I went with this screen size over the seven and eight-inch options. I love having a larger size screen to handle everything. I mean, for goodness sake, I did everything for my college finals on this tablet. All in all a wonderful device that offers portability,  functionality, great front-facing speakers, a stylish look, and an alternative for viewing books and movies. Love this!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: CONROY SAMUEL
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. I have two Laptops but don't use them much anymore. I have read the reviews on this model and the Galaxy tablet 3. Really happy I chose this one. It is all that I expected. No issues whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: chris c "chris c"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present and wow oh wow this tablet is amazing. definitely worth every penny. buy buy buy!

Reviews.Title: Gave as a gift...
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my boyfriend for Christmas & he absolutely loves it. Very sharp, dependable product.  He mostly uses it for games, drawing (S-Pen is phenomenal), and social networking. Great device & no problems yet.

Reviews.Title: the best tablet ive used
Reviews.Author: MagicsoundSucks
Reviews.Content: This tablet arrived like new just as described and on time. The galaxy is in my opinion better than the iPad. Its super easy to use and looks beautiful. I couldn't ask for a better tablet. Can't wait to own a 2014 model. Before you buy a tablet try the galaxy note. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful tablet!!
Reviews.Author: kevin swanner
Reviews.Content: The picture and clarity are brilliant. The productivity tools and it's S features make this tablet well worth the purchase. It far outweighs the ipad in gaming, productivity and it's fun extras. Have always been partial to Samsung and their line of products. With all of it's wonderful qualities and it's 10.1 screen, it's great for movie watching, playing games and so much more. Price is a no brainer !!! Kudos to Samsung for a brilliant tablet, great quality with a $$ saving price.Samsung fan always.

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Note 10 is Excellent
Reviews.Author: Victor A. Carnes
Reviews.Content: The product came as advertised and included a reference to a book of instructions that can be read and printed from the internet. I found the product in a better than new condition since it was refurbished at the factory to remove defects if any found.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: mgh
Reviews.Content: I wondered if I would use a tablet, and was concerned about the resolution on the Note, as reviewers gush over the higher resolution on the Nexus 10.I use this all day long, and the resolution is very good.  When reading a book on it, if I look very closely, I can see some slight shadowing effect on the text, but certainly not enough to notice otherwise.I thought the S-pen might turn into a novelty, but I use it almost every time I use the tablet.Web pages and apps load quickly.  I have a Google Nexus phone, and wondered about having to deal with Samsung's interface over the stock Google Android interface, but have found that it does not bother me a bit.This is a very nice tablet!  I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: My NEW Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jeanette K. Thomason
Reviews.Content: I Love it....so crystal clear....very easy to set up.... Loaded all my apps in about 1hour.  Was able to use it right out of the box.  Anyone looking for a Tab, need look no further.

Reviews.Title: Dreamy
Reviews.Author: SF
Reviews.Content: It has great touch-response, fast performance, lots of great apps available, beautiful screen. Battery life is amazing. Best tablet we've tried.

Reviews.Title: Top of the line tablet
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: I currently have the Note 2 phone and it influenced me to get the tablet. Love the SPen! The quad core processor is a plus! I personally prefer quad core electronics. The large screen size make games, pictures, and videos all the more awesome. The camera is ok. Don't expect a low spec camera to do much. lol I haven't had any trouble with it sofar. Works great!

Reviews.Title: Use It Every Day
Reviews.Author: Emelie
Reviews.Content: I was one of those that scorned at the rising trend of tablets, thinking it unnecessary and show-off toys. But then my inner tech-geek started to yearn for one. They're small, they're easy to just stuff in your bag, brining with you loads of entertainment and utilities all the time. Being a university student I used to bring my Macbook to school for taking notes. It was heavy and clumsy.Bringing the Note along is so easy and it doesn't weight anything. In fact, I never leave home without it now.The primary use I had in mind for it was note-taking during lectures and classes. It offers a wide variety for doing so just with with the tools that is already installed on the tablet. You can freehand with the pen, you can have your handwriting translated into text, and you can write as if on a computer.A bonus is that it offers a variety of drawing apps for when I get dead bored in school. Doodling is more fun, and so easy with the tablet!It has become my saviour during my all-in-all 2 hour trip to school and back home. It's easy to just dig it out from your bag and start watching films, the screen is nice with good colours and clarity, or read a book. There is apps out there that's really good both for films and reading. I started to read solely on this tablet, abandoning my Sony e-reader because the tablet had better app-utilities for reading (stuff that the new Kindle Paperwhite have so I'm going to give that one a try now).All in all, I use it far more than I ever thought I would, and to do various tasks and for enjoyment. The battery life is good and quite normal. When using it sparsely it lasts for days. When using it more heavily it can lasts for about 2 days with no problem.It has given me my money's worth and I'm pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Love the features
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have to say the features on this are so amazing.I love the Snote feature, the photoshop and overall the performance of this tablet is perfect for a student like me

Reviews.Title: All great, but can't open many e-mails" not designed for mobile device"
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: All great, but can't open many e-mails" not designed for mobile device"Otherwise works just like my Galaxy phone. Very easy and fast.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet - great investment
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet so that i could read a variety of books and be able to use word, excel, and other applications without the bulk of carrying a laptop. So far ive found it easy to use despite having no experience in the past with tablets. Touch  screen, browsing, downloading is good. Resolution, camera, navigation are excellent. Highly rate it. Great buy

Reviews.Title: One of my fav gadgets.
Reviews.Author: Larry W.
Reviews.Content: Stereo speakers, Android OS and can carry it on my motorcycle when traveling. Plenty of memory and you can add a 64gb card.Only problem I have had with mine is the WiFi and my Netgear router will loose connection about once a month. Reset both and good to go again. I like the speakers on the front instead of the back.

Reviews.Title: Love the features
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have to say the features on this are so amazing.I love the Snote feature, the photoshop and overall the performance of this tablet is perfect for a student like me

Reviews.Title: All great, but can't open many e-mails" not designed for mobile device"
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: All great, but can't open many e-mails" not designed for mobile device"Otherwise works just like my Galaxy phone. Very easy and fast.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet - great investment
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet so that i could read a variety of books and be able to use word, excel, and other applications without the bulk of carrying a laptop. So far ive found it easy to use despite having no experience in the past with tablets. Touch  screen, browsing, downloading is good. Resolution, camera, navigation are excellent. Highly rate it. Great buy

Reviews.Title: One of my fav gadgets.
Reviews.Author: Larry W.
Reviews.Content: Stereo speakers, Android OS and can carry it on my motorcycle when traveling. Plenty of memory and you can add a 64gb card.Only problem I have had with mine is the WiFi and my Netgear router will loose connection about once a month. Reset both and good to go again. I like the speakers on the front instead of the back.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. I ordered one for my wife a few months ago and enjoyed using her's so much I had to get on for me. I use the spen to take hand written notes in meetings. Loaded with Samsung apps that are really useful. I have seen complaints about the interface that Samsung has loaded with the tablet, but I have to say I really enjoy it. It may take some getting use to, but once you do you will love it, just like any new technology.

Reviews.Title: For every thing I do, my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 is there
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: I've had my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 since October 2012.  It was a birthday present to myself.I initially considered not purchasing it.  I thought it was a bit overpriced without providing 3g or now 4g.  At the time I had the 7 in Samsung tablet with 3g built in.  That being said, I am  very happy with this product.It is very well built, it is dependable, has a decent battery life.  It brings you so many options.  I use it in almost every aspect of my life.  It is my alarm clock, I get the current weather in the mornings.  I glance at my list of things coming up on my calendar pop up on my home page and it gives me reminders of things coming up soon.I have a very busy life and this tablet is my personal assistant.
