Reviews.Content: THIS NOTE BOOK SOUNDED LIKE A GOOD DEAL AND HAS MORE THAN WHAT I REALLY NEED BUT WANT TO LEARN WHAT THIS TABLETS GOT TO OFFER. HOPEFULLY IT WILL MEET ALL MY DEMANDS.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointing
Reviews.Author: RL
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the wife and perhaps just my poor research and expectations but I would have expected that this would be able to do much of what a windows based tablet would do.  A good example is setting up a printer.  It won't work unless you have a samsung printer!  Do they even make one?  There's a way to print via cloud but why make it so difficult  (I tried cloud printing BTW but what I have tried has not worked)?  I happen to hate farmville but, she plays it and you can't do (there is only a framville light app) what you can do with a pc based tablet.So, I bit the bullet, bought the wife another laptop and gave this tablet to my 7 yr old son for his IXL (internet math and language art learning) excersizes.  Unfortunately it doesn't easily do all of functions of that website either.  It's asking I download Adobe flash player.  Which the Adobe website says is not supported by the Galaxy note.  I think this is the same issue that is causing farmville not to have full functionality.  Printing and Adobe flash player are basic functions!!!  This purchase was a mistake :(

Reviews.Title: no flash
Reviews.Author: John A Ziegler
Reviews.Content: I was very disapointed when I found out I can'get on Amazon Video, etc. No Adobe flash!  Also all the screens and bar at the bottom are Very busy.  I don' know how easy it is to delete things I'll never need, if I can delete at all.  I can't find a decent manual either  the built in help is very weak.  I do like the graphics.  I should have bought an Ipad.  I got this because of the stylus being hard and sharp, but not so important now.ziggy

Reviews.Title: Use it all the time.
Reviews.Author: Patricia Corrow "Patti"
Reviews.Content: I gave it 4 stars because I enjoy using it very much.  Of course I'm still learning how it works. But so far so good.

Reviews.Title: its ok
Reviews.Author: R. Khattak "Jalal Khan"
Reviews.Content: The tablet box seal was broken.i contacted and was told that its new and not refurbished item. However I was not expecting this from seller with high reviews. The delivery was earlier than estimated time. Product is fine and I love Samsung products but seller gets 3 stars for product seal broken.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet but it does not support flash!
Reviews.Author: Karemah Coakley
Reviews.Content: One reason I bought this tablet so I could watch anime on the go and was EXTREMELY disappointed and angry to find out that it did not support the adobe flash player that the site uses. I knew that the iPad didn't support flash but that is why I went with this tablet because I heard that it did and was hoping I would be able to watch my anime shows but apparently this tablet doesn't support it either.

Reviews.Title: Great idea, LOTS OF BUGS
Reviews.Author: brendan
Reviews.Content: I love having a pen, I like the speakers, but there is so much sloppy about this it is very frustrating, especially when compared to my Galaxy Nexus w/ stock Android.Touchwiz Skin: generally looks bad, ugly colors, icons and patterns look bad on the low-res screen, everything in general is much less slick and intuitive than native AndroidConstruction: plastic is creaky and flimsySoftware bugs - a few examplesWhen you open S Note, your screen brightness will suddenly increase.The screen brightness changes when you pass your hand over the sensor, even for a second or two.Customized vibration settings (haptic feedback) will sometimes be lost when switching the tablet to vibrate and back.S Pen tends to go a bit wacky within 1-2 cm of the edge of the screenLots of missing features:S Pen button doesn't do anything you want it toNo way to disable page-turning sound in S NoteNo way to select and move shapes/drawings in S Note

Reviews.Title: Sync Problems
Reviews.Author: mitdc
Reviews.Content: I got the Samsung Note 10.1 to replace the Acer 500 that I dropped.  The Note 10.1 may have many advanced features, but it fails on the basic function on syncing contacts and calendars with Outlook. Samsung uses Kies as its sync program.  I've had continual problems with Kies.  At first it said it did not support my device! Tried discussing with Samsung support and they were no help. The online Kies tutorial and the section on Kies in the downloaded manual were of no help.  I reloaded Kies on my PC.  It did sync-once.  After that it updated contacts but not the calendar.  Being unable to sync the calendar is a major flaw.  Also, the Note 10.1 has no built in full size or mini USB or HDMI ports.  Samsung does offer adapters that connect to the charging port--but that is an extra cost and an inconvience.

Reviews.Title: this is pure headache
Reviews.Author: vladimir josue
Reviews.Content: The box came in with a broken seal (definite red flag) and now there are display issues where the screen flickers and goes green . I am so pissed as this was suppose to be a birthday gift ,and now i have to deal with the frustration of having to go for an exchange and hopefully get something else that is not gonna be defective. Anyone else had similar experience with their note 10.1.?

Reviews.Title: WiFi suddenly doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Park
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a couple of months, but from about 2 weeks ago, the wifi stopped working on my school network. It says in the settings that it's connected to the school network, but when I try to access the internet, it doesn't work. I tried getting some assistance, but all I got back was a couple of links to standard troubleshooting webpages that didn't help and then was told to factory reset the tab. I don't really need wifi that much and use the note to take notes, and would rather not have to back everything up again, so I'm going without the wifi. I don't know if the problem is with the device, android OS, the school network or any combination of the three but the problem is that since this device isn't as popular as the iPad, the problem isn't going to be solved anytime soon.So if you need reliable access to wifi, this device may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: As Androids to, this is the best one.
Reviews.Author: Jack Pepper "pepperjack"
Reviews.Content: What is best about this product is the 32gb of storage.  This seems limitless for a tablet. And it works as advertised.  I don't like it because it comes with way too many icons on the home pages and no way I could find to delete them.  This makes for clutter and wasted space for me.  In other words, despite the many great features, I felt I was not in control.  And I confess, I bought one of the first iPads when they came out, have upgraded every time since so am pretty much married to the iPad.  But just because I don't care tor this great Samsung product doesn't mean you won't fall in love with it.

Reviews.Title: Has some issues
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Flash does not work on this version. Very frustrating to use. What use is a media consumption devise if you can't play all media.I bought this to replace my paper notebook. I really wanted to like it and be able to use it. But the technology is not there yet.I use chrome browser on this and it seems to freeze a lot on it.May25th- Updated to 3 star after using it some more.

Reviews.Title: Changed my review
Reviews.Author: Dovahkiin
Reviews.Content: Old review: Was so excited to get my new Note 10.1! Unfortunately, the screen has amazingly terrible backlight bleeding.This seems to stem from a multicolored spot on the screen that is visible at an angle. It works but in my opinion, $500bucks wasted.New review:Received my refund and a brand new gorgeous grey tablet. Changed my review to reflect my new opinion. My bro has aniPad3 so wherever I mention it, I base it on my personal experience.1. I would have given this 5 stars if I got a perfect unit in the first place. Keep that in mind.2. The screen is excellent. The iPad3 is barely better. Side by side and careful scrutiny is the only way you would  know. Text is nice and crisp, HD movies look great. There has been much talk about ppi. These devices have more ppi  than most desktop monitors. So don't be bothered about IPS comparisons. The screen is fine.2.5. That said, Try the backlight bleed test from the Play Store and you will notice it does have noticeable bleeding.  Not as bad as the unit I returned, but still bleeding.3. The build quality is fine. No it doesn't feel "cheap" at all. I realize most Americans hate plastic. Metal is also  superior IMHO but there is nothing wrong with the plastic back. There is no creaking on this, nor was there any on  the unit I returned. Also some people said if you squeeze the back it would touch the board inside. Not true in my  experience. Bought the case from Poetic and well you can't tell what it's made of in a case...4. It is snappy. I will confess that it did slow down gradually with use. Faster once I got the last OTA update.5. The S-Pen is amazing. Handwriting recognition is >90% for me. My handwriting is fairly good though, so mileage may  vary. Bought the "7Notes" app and it is amazing. I also dabble in art (I'm no artist) and the S-Pen is great. I must  say, it does almost feel...comfortable, like the real thing.6. Skype is great but it is and always has been buggy for me. The video quality, at least through Skype, is much better  than the iPad 3 for some reason. Skype crashes on any device I use at some point.7. The speakers are loud and front facing, woo-hoo! I still think they could be louder on tablets but this design is a  good start.8. I dislike the proprietary dock. A standard port would have been appreciated for many reasons.9. The camera takes nice pictures. Screen shot function is also good.10. I dislike the screenshot shortcut on the menu bar. Since the last OTA, Power + VolUp also gives screenshot. I want  the option to remove that shortcut.11. Unit takes a long time to charge. Haven't timed it, but I guess maybe 3 hours.12. No issues with Wi-Fi like some people have reported.13. I want Jelly Bean. I have been to xda forums and an UNofficial Jelly Bean update is available for the 3G version.  Dev is also quiet at the moment, they are also probably waiting on JB.With all that I have said here, this is my tablet of choice for a couple reasons:1. It is gorgeous2. The display is nice and bright3. Speed4. Best darn tablet for using a digital pen.

Reviews.Title: Does not add much for regular e-readers
Reviews.Author: R. Sabir
Reviews.Content: I bought the device to overcome some of the missing features of the current readers available in the market. Basically I was expecting to use the S Pen on an e reader, to underline, write on the margins and highlight as used in Kno. But unfortunately, Kno as I believe is not a regular reader, as it is aimed for text books and therefore, it is useful mostly for university students and not regular readers.Also, I really hate the samsung/android not available in this country thing.Coming from an IOS world, I noticed that the readers on Android are way behind. On an iPad the libraries have more books, plus it is easier to highlight and write notes on the them.Overall the device has huge potential with great ideas, but unfortunately I don't believe the software is catching up with the hardware of the device. I guess samsung should work harder on apps to enrich their store and utilize the hardware of the device.

Reviews.Title: maybe we got the lemon....but ours overheats, crashes, battery dies-Samsung Customer/Tech Support is THE WORST!!!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "BBB"
Reviews.Content: Am actually writing this on my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 which is sooo much better than this Samsung Note tab which my hubby now regrets buying!If you want a great tablet for movies..tv shows....Netflix...HuluPlus....save some $$$ and get the Kindle Hd...the picture and sound is far superior!  If you are an artist or want an s-pen pay more $$ you may like the Samsung....not much difference in screen size! Our Samsung nightmare started fairly soon when we noticed how hot the device was running....battery was draining way too quickly....volume TERRIBLE compared to The stereo greatness of my Fire Hd...but the NIGHTMARE escalated when contacting their outsourced Tech Support.....support.... is a joke...they were terrible....provided no help after weeks of hours upon hours calls...always promising to "escalate the call to TIER 2" requesting you to be home several nights at a certain time so they could attempt to reach you...when multiple times they NEVER called back.  So we'd call again....spend at least another hour on the phone getting the exact same runaround!!!!  When you purchase a product, IMO the Customer Service HAS to be just as stellar as the product. Sadly Id rather have dental surgery without pain killers before Id have to deal with their INEPT CS!!! Our neighbor has a 8.9 Samsung tablet whos Media Hub died on him...he lost several hundreds of dollars worth of  movies etc. as they never got back to help him either and he went over three months of calling  trying to get his Media Hub back.  We only wish we'd talked to him first....we're now hoping the great customer service here at Amazon will help us in the return of our headache of a very defective Samsung Note 10.1 tablet! I merely hope that all of the favorable reviews here never...ever...need to call Samsungs Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: Does not add much for regular e-readers
Reviews.Author: R. Sabir
Reviews.Content: I bought the device to overcome some of the missing features of the current readers available in the market. Basically I was expecting to use the S Pen on an e reader, to underline, write on the margins and highlight as used in Kno. But unfortunately, Kno as I believe is not a regular reader, as it is aimed for text books and therefore, it is useful mostly for university students and not regular readers.Also, I really hate the samsung/android not available in this country thing.Coming from an IOS world, I noticed that the readers on Android are way behind. On an iPad the libraries have more books, plus it is easier to highlight and write notes on the them.Overall the device has huge potential with great ideas, but unfortunately I don't believe the software is catching up with the hardware of the device. I guess samsung should work harder on apps to enrich their store and utilize the hardware of the device.

I merely hope that all of the favorable reviews here never...ever...need to call Samsungs Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat Disappointed...
Reviews.Author: Mikie G
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when the tablet arrived...unfortunately, as with so many products in the marketplace today, the concept is great, but in practice, it just does not deliver the goods...for a comprehensive, unbiased, extremely valuable and on-point review that reflects the reality of this device, I urge you to read Ron Amadeo's Android Police review entitled "Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 Review: An Embarrassing, Lazy, Arrogant Money Grab"...just go to Android Police dot com and search for the title. The communist party censors at Amazon will not allow me to paste a URL.

Reviews.Title: Asus t700 is a much better choice
Reviews.Author: nicolae s
Reviews.Content: About a year ago I picked up an iPad2.  I really didn't like how it didn't talk well to anything outside its snobby "I" circle.  However, I must admit, it is well built, feels good in your hands, looks crisp and runs super smooth.  Anyway, I decided to switch to an Android tablet given that all our phones use that OS and we're happy with it.  The choice came between the 10.1 Samsung Note and the Asus T700 Transformer.  Maybe I have more trust in the Samsung brand, I don't know, that was my first choice.  I returned it after 2 days.  It feels like a cheap piece of plastic in your hands.  No wonder BestBuy can get people to pay about 30% more just for a one year warranty addition.  They probably have to replace almost one out of every three sold, they are built so cheaply.It runs ok, but Samsung would do well to educate the potential customers as to why that stylus of theirs is so great.  I didn't have the time and the patience to search the web to find out what sets this apart.  Couldn't find much educational stylus stuff in the tablet itself.The Asus has better screen resolution(1,920 by 1,200 or (224ppi) vs. Samsung with 1,280 by 800 pixels or 149(ppi)), better processing power(1.6GHz vs 1.4GHz in the Ssamsung) and twice the memory right out of the box.  With the keyboard adapter it also has more battery, easy USB hookup and a full size SD card slot.  Not to mention the laptop form factor.  It is also built sturdy and with a nice aluminum back.  The only thing the Samsung has better is a pair of stereo front facing speakers and supposedly the stylus.  The Samsung was disappointing considering the choices at this price point

Reviews.Title: annoying
Reviews.Author: w_s_t
Reviews.Content: I was eager to receive what was among the highest-rated Android tablets to-date (early October 2012). Within a day of use, I was reminded of why I dumped my Galaxy phone a couple years ago for a Nexus. Manufacturers crippled the OS, and load the device up with apps they think you should have. Time after time, I would go to the app store and receive a message that the app is incompatible with my device. I even had to mess around just to install the Amazon app store. Who knows when/if they will ever get around to upgrading to the current version of Android, and what additional incompatibility issues that will introduce.Perhaps I would have been more satisfied (or at least looked past the limitations of this expensive tablet) if I used the S Pen, which some indicate is a legitimate differentiator, but I did not. So, I dumped this on eBay for a $80 loss, and look forward to getting a "pure Google" tablet - Nexus. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: S PEN
Reviews.Author: Sean K.
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my dad in Florida and he asked me if it was supposed to come with an S Pen and It looks as if it was supposed to.  There was no S Pen included with the tablet.  Would like to know what I can do about this.thanks

Reviews.Title: Haven't had a chance to use it as I've been ill for a while.
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Lyons
Reviews.Content: It is rated so high by Consumer Reports. Wouldn't have an Apple. It seems to be so simple to operate.

Reviews.Title: Great Item!!!
Reviews.Author: Stewart J. Smith "Stewcara"
Reviews.Content: I received my tablet opened. But I am not returning it coz i badly need it coz am travelling to other country. I dont like the packaging. My tablet box is opened! This is not new one. This is second hand, a returned tablet. Not buying again. Please, instruct your employee who sends your items. Tell the person who sent this to me, why on earth did they send it opened?  And why even if they knew is was opened, yet they still sent it? Not anymore buying! Thanks for you. You may not believe me that this tablet box was opened, but i dont care! JUST TELL YOUR PEOPLE TO SEND NEW PRODUCTS AND NOT OLD ONE! I love the tablet. Just tell your sender, to be honest on how they deal with customers online! I am not returning it, coz my palce doesnt have this yet. I will keep this. I will forget the tablet opened. but i will not buy again and not trust the sender or whoever is responsible for this! Thanks and I love amazon. I just hate the person who sent this to me! not again. I will not recommend you to my family.

Reviews.Title: Not really a professional tablet
Reviews.Author: Mohammad
Reviews.Content: I was waiting for device for couple of months and I got it on the release date from BestBuy, buy I returned it the next day.My wife has an ipad 2 and I have been playing with that as well so I can compare them together.Why I was waiting for this: I do math and my main use of tablet is long note taking, reading and annotating pdf files , and surfing the web. So a real PEN matters to me and Ipad lacks this ability.Note taking: The hardware is great and pen is accurate enough but the S NOTE app in not as easy to use as it should be. But it is good overall.Annotating PDF:  Here is the first problem,  S NOTE does not allow to opn PDF s and edit them. Therefore you need some other app, the best I found is ezPDF which is still not perfect, for example it does not have eraser.  The NOTABILITY app on Ipad is much better than that.Surfing Web: I often listen to embedded audios and talks in websites and meanwhile I want to do other things on my laptop\tablet (This is called multitasking). This works on Ipad, but it does not work on Android !! A big disappointment.Reading PDFs: Resolution and pdf reading experience is not even comparable with Ipad. There is an annoying back light which does not let you raed Pdfs easily. You can see the Pixels and thats not good. After returning the device, I checked (the new) Ipad again,  readying PDF on that was really nice.Beside all these there some more (important) things you may want to know:-- Although processor is powerful but I don't feel any difference even with ipad 2, I can even say that the Ipad is smoother. I should mention that I never do gaming so I don't know about the difference in that area.-- If you occasionally visit websites in other languages (than English), for example Arabic, Farsi,... the fonts are horrible and You need another KeyBoard app to handle writing. Ipad does this job excellent.Conclusion: Although I am not fan of any particular company, but if you don't need PEN then this device does not even come close to Ipad, so don't waste your Money. If you need a gaming device, I don't know. I most probably wait for Microsoft Surface Pro, which hopefully answer my needs.

Reviews.Title: Touch Panel Quit Working After less than 24hrs
Reviews.Author: T. Beck
Reviews.Content: I purchased this at best buy on the 21, it was a great tablet, I loved it and the S Pen, then the touch panel quit working.  It would not respond to touch or to the S Pen, face unlock and the volume and power buttons work, I made the 3hr drive to my Best Buy and got a replacement, as soon as I powered it up at home, it had dead pixels and backlight bleed, I will be returning the Second Note and waiting for the Next iPad most likely being announced Sept 13. DO NOT BUY. SAMSUNG EPIC FAILED ON THIS.

Reviews.Title: Not user frendly
Reviews.Author: Vildan
Reviews.Content: I have all the Apple devices iPod, iTouch, iPad and iPhone. Two months ago my son wanted to buy a tablet, than I decided to buy a Samsung Tablet. But after all those Apple experience, I realized that it was a mistake. That Samsung is not a user frendly device as much as Apple. If you are familiar with Apple, continue with Apple, Android is not good for us.

Reviews.Title: It is the worst tablet I have ever used
Reviews.Author: Pohan
Reviews.Content: I bought it at Costco and tried whole night to figure out the hand writing and according to manual to switch the keyboard to hand writing and it does not work and when you are surfacing website it stuck and I could not enter the text for the news on Yahoo, it may be some wrong settings but it is not user friendly at all, I will return it today and try another

Reviews.Title: Quick Samsung money-grab
Reviews.Author: vancephoto "Vance"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this tablet for my birthday. I had grand visions of using it to replace pen and paper/printouts for my university classes. It's definitely lacking in functionality that a student and even an average person would need in order to operate the tablet well. For example, converting .pdf files into the s-note application takes about 10 seconds per page. If you are converting a large file in order to write on it (say a .pdf deck of slides for class), then S-note takes 10-20 minutes easily just so you can use the fabled s-pen in an efficient way (not many apps take advantage of palm rejection, have smoothing, etc, only S-note does)In my opinion (as an owner), poor functionality as anything other than a notepad/sketchpad (aka difficult to write on lecture slides, word docs, etc.) leads to a tablet that should have been, but isn't, great. There you go folks. Go buy something else!EDIT: The Note actually charges using more power than micro-USB provides. So it does seem reasonable to have a proprietary charger. I've edited the review and added a star accordingly.EDIT 2: The major problem with the Note now is that when you write in S-note with the palm on the screen, it thinks you are trying to resize the screen. So while palm reject effectively works, the resizing the screen problem is an extreme annoyance that happens every time you lift your palm to move down a line (which is often because the Note's screen isn't nearly as wide as a sheet of paper). Also, if you are writing on a flat surface (Which most of us are), your arm will hit the menu which will pop up again, when you move your palm. It's easy to close and resize, but after doing it a million times, you'd rather just use paper and scan it in. Serious design flaw that many users are having. Curious if anyone has found a fix for this issue.EDIT 3: LectureNotes by Acadoid does what S-note is supposed to do for students. Highly recommended, it will make the Note 10.1 functional enough to take high-quality notes in certain classes.

Reviews.Title: Wow, what a mess
Reviews.Author: Noneofyour "Noneofyour"
Reviews.Content: This product is a nightmare. It comes full of garbage apps you don't need, and after a week of struggling to get it to do the most basic things I need, I am sending it back. There are no instructions whatsoever, and the ones I did find referenced screens, commands or icons that didn't exist on my device. As for the physical characteristics of the device, the speakers are barely audible, it dropped my wireless constantly, the screen barely responds (even with the stylus), and battery life is nonexistent (I got two hours of use out of a charge and I was just surfing the web).

Reviews.Title: I can't believe it's new!!!
Reviews.Author: Eunjin Kim
Reviews.Content: I bought it 20th on May and there was blackout just a moment. So I asked to exchange it. And dilivvery guy just left new one in front of my door.The thing is.. plastic seal on the product was damaged. The box seal was okay but there was some dust under the vinyl seal. I have bought Samsung products over than 20 times since my twenty..from 2G cell phone, smart phone,desktop, laptop, smart TV...ect. I don't think Samsung works this way. Even in 1990's there's no dust under vinyl seal and that seal had no wrinkle.If it's not Amazon's fault, I will leave this comment on Samsung website and user's blog too with pictures taken with my DSLR. I am so disappointed and upset .

Reviews.Title: Missing package
Reviews.Author: Rollegirl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for my birthday and it never arrived.  Lately too many of my packages are going missing

Reviews.Title: The truth
Reviews.Author: John Hoffman "turdflop"
Reviews.Content: just get the Ipad, pay for a stylus. It is easier on the eyes, after long hours of study...  easier on the eyes.  The Ipad is closer to the printed page, and more generous on its graphics.  Samsung is giving too little for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: powers up and pisses you off
Reviews.Author: angryandroid
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my wife, which ruined our night. The unit randomly freezes, shuts off, reboots, slows, the apps won't install, will work for a minute, then freeze, then reboot, battery is charged, unit is new, ugh, time to return it.Edit: My Note did not have a pen in the box when it arrived, which leads me to believe this was a return item, shame on Amazon for shipping me this as new. My original review stands, the unit randomly freezes and reboots, apps do not run for more than a minute, not sure what else to add technically, I tried updating, etc. If this unit is not defective, wow, for 500? ouch

ProductInfo.Features:
Android 4.1 Jelly Bean, 10.1 inch Display,S Pen included
Samsung Tablet 1.4 GHz Quad-Core Processor
2 GB RAM Memory, 32GB On-Board Memory
Camera Front: 1.9 MP, Back: 5 MP
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 (32GB, Deep Grey)
